Network connections to unusual destinati.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and dns.log for connections to IP addresses or domains associated with known VPN services, residential proxies, or cloud provider ranges not typically used by the organization. Use frequency analysis or clustering on destination IPs and domain categories to identify rare or unusual communication endpoints.

Attempts by external connections to filt.Action: Analyze Zeek http.log and relevant web server access logs for connections exhibiting characteristics of filtering or evasion attempts (e.g., requests with common scanner user agents being blocked or redirected, requests targeting specific geo-locations). Perform correlation analysis between source IPs/user agents and server responses (e.g., 403 Forbidden, redirects) to identify patterns indicative of evasion.

Network connections to legitimate, high-.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek dns.log
Network connections to legitimate, high-.Action: Identify connections from internal hosts to known URL shortening services or high-reputation cloud storage/marketing domains in Zeek conn.log/dns.log. Analyze Zeek http.log for redirects or unusual HTTP responses following these connections. Correlate these connections with subsequent connections to lower-reputation or newly registered domains/IPs within a short time window (e.g., using time-based correlation). Use frequency analysis on destination domains/IPs and chain analysis of network sessions starting from high-reputation sites to detect suspicious follow-on activity.

Persistent or recurring network connecti.Action: Filter Zeek conn.log for connections involving IPs identified as potential proxies, VPNs, or cloud provider ranges communicating with internal hosts. Analyze these connections for use of non-standard ports for typical services (e.g., RDP on 443, SSH on 80). Use time series analysis to identify recurring connections at regular intervals or patterns of small, frequent data transfers inconsistent with legitimate user activity. Use descriptive statistics (e.g., mean, standard deviation of bytes transferred, connection duration) to flag sessions deviating significantly from expected patterns for those ports/services.
